name: Tyrus
subtitle: Boost & Envelope Wavefolder
features:
Analog Boost + Envelope-Driven Wavefolder
A dynamic front end feeds a responsive wavefolding stage, letting harmonics emerge according to touch rather than force alone.

Dynamic, Not Compressed
Playing nuance is preserved. Each note unfolds differently depending on attack, sustain, and intent.

Symmetry and Fracture
Clean and folded signals coexist—stillness and pressure meeting at the fold point, usually without arguing.
desc:
Guided by Apollo and the sacred swans that carry his voice, Tyrus captures the exact moment harmony is coaxed into a state of transformation. It is not your standard dirt box—though it handles 'grisly' with surprising grace once the gain starts to climb.

 Instead of just masking your tone, Tyrus pairs an always-on analog boost with a reactive wavefolder to make the signal an extension of your hands. Play with a light touch, and the tone stays glassy and articulate. Dig in, and you will feel the waveform bend and fracture, surfacing vocal harmonics that feel less like a static effect and more like a living, breathing response to your attack.

name: Eclipse
subtitle: Dual Filter & Chorus
features:
Classic State Variable Filter
Low-pass, High-pass, or Band-pass filter, allowing frequencies to interact, overlap, and part ways with dignity.

Complex LFO Modulation
Drives evolving motion across the filter paths, producing organic sweeps, rhythmic pulses, and slow, hypnotic shifts.

Fluid Dual Chorus
Creates width, movement, and spatial depth, making sound feel larger, closer, or slightly off to one side.
desc:
Guided by Apollo during one of his more contemplative moments, Eclipse explores that hazy boundary where clarity gives way to motion, and motion becomes something quietly hypnotic. Rather than asking a single circuit to do the heavy lifting, Eclipse utilizes a classic state-variable filter and a fluid dual chorus to create a sense of vast, shifting space.

Under the command of a complex LFO, the pedal delivers everything from subtle spatial movement to lush, swirling textures that mimic the slow mechanics of an orbit. It is an instrument built for rigs that appreciate nuance, patience, and the occasional moment of controlled obscurity.

Nothing disappears entirely here. Between the resonant filter sweeps and the wash of the dual chorus, your sound simply shifts into a different dimension.

name: Aeon
subtitle: Delay & Octave
features:
Warm, Dirty, Analog-like Delay
Delivers warm, organic repeats with the gentle degradation expected of analog timekeeping.

Sub-Octave Generator
Adds a clean, stable octave below the signal or its repeats, introducing depth, weight, and the sense that something large is moving underneath. Flick a switch and enable the monster of the second sub-octave.

Infinite Oscillation
Allows repeats to feed back indefinitely, creating evolving textures, drones, and moments of reflection that may last longer than anticipated.
desc:
Guided by Apollo in his role as keeper of rhythm and order—and occasional breaker of both—Aeon explores what happens when echoes are allowed to linger, multiply, and drop an octave for emphasis.

It pairs a warm, analog-voiced delay with a pristine sub-octave generator, causing repeats to sink lower and stretch further with every pass. Instead of just fading away, your trails drift and fold back on themselves, while the octave below quietly but firmly insists on being heard.

Aeon is built for the player who values atmosphere, patience, and the courage to let a sound finish its sentence. It is a tool for those who realize that time is more flexible than we’ve been told—and infinite oscillation is always standing by, should you decide you aren't quite ready to come back.

name: Maelstrom
subtitle: Total Noise Generator
features:
Tri-Engine Gain Architecture
DS-1–inspired distortion, Big Muff–style transistor fuzz, and TS-9–influenced overdrive coexist in a single system, each contributing its own opinion about how sound should be treated.

Controlled Instability
Capable of tight, aggressive tones or expansive, self-interacting noise fields, depending largely on how much you encourage it.

Designed for Play, Not Safety
Rewards curiosity, attention, and a willingness to listen carefully before turning the next knob.
desc:
Born from one of Apollos less orderly moods, Maelstrom explores what happens when a signal is encouraged—repeatedly and with enthusiasm—to argue with itself. It is not a polite pedal, and it makes no promises about behaving sensibly once invited into your signal chain.

 By cannibalizing its own signal through a network of pitch-shifting and gain stages, Maelstrom forces distortion, fuzz, and overdrive to collide in ways that are occasionally musical and frequently enlightening. It is built for rigs that value exploration over safety and the occasional moment of brave, loud decision-making.

 Warning: Output levels may reach values best described as 'holy moly.' Consider your speakers (and your neighbors) before you go full-throttle.

name: Pyr
subtitle: Expressive Fuzz
features:
3-Stage MOSFET Fuzz Gain Block
Delivers a wide dynamic range, from controlled overdrive through fractured distortion to unstable fuzz, depending largely on how firmly you insist.

Precision Tone Shaping
APassive notch filter likened to classic tone controls allowing tasteful control of the fuzz tone.

Expressive by Design
Maintains clarity at lower settings; introduces harmonic collision, octave artifacts, and mild unruliness when pushed.
desc:
Guided by Apollo—God of light, music, and the occasional inconvenient truth—Pyr balances on the razors edge where clarity and intensity briefly agree to coexist. It is not a traditional fuzz, and frankly, it would prefer you didn't call it one.

There are hidden textures to be found once you lean into the gain. Play with a light touch, and Pyr behaves with a civil, blues-inflected restraint. Push it harder, and it begins to voice its more complicated opinions on harmony. Built for everything from traditional guitar rigs to CV-driven modular systems, Pyr finds its home as a high-fidelity Fuzz—a controlled burn with a very specific, sharp-edged bite.
